0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Bexsero(R) (25 years or younger) 0.5 mL IM 2-dose series 1 month apart
  • Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Trumenba(TM) (25 years or younger) 0.5 mL IM 3-dose series on a 0-, 2-, and 6-month schedule
  • Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Do not use other meningococcal vaccines interchangeably to complete the vaccination series

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Bexsero(R) (10 years or older) 0.5 mL IM 2-dose series 1 month apart
  • Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Trumenba(TM) (10 years or older) 0.5 mL IM 3-dose series on a 0-, 2-, and 6-month schedule
  • Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis: Do not use other meningococcal vaccines interchangeably to complete the vaccination series

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Meningococcal infectious disease, Neisseria meningitidis group B; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: Previous hypersensitivity or severe allergic reaction to meningococcal group B vaccine or any component of the vaccine

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- Syncope may occur
  • Immunologic:
  • -- Acute anaphylactic reaction may occur; monitoring recommended
  • -- Immunocompromised patients may have decreased immune response to vaccine.
  • -- Latex sensitivity; tip caps of the Bexsero(R) prefilled syringes contain natural rubber latex; Trumenba(TM) prefilled syringes do NOT contain natural rubber latex

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Erythema at injection site (14.9% to 50%), Injection site induration (28% to 32%), Injection site pain (83% to 92.8%), Swelling at injection site (18.2% to 21.6%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (18% to 19%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (13% to 21.6%), Myalgia (30.5% to 49%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (34.8% to 54.8%)
  • Other:Fatigue (35% to 62.4%), Feels cold (15.6% to 29%)
Serious
Immunologic:Anaphylaxis

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Immunization with meningococcal group B vaccine is intended to stimulate the production of bactericidal antibodies against antigens comprised in the vaccine. The Trumenba(TM) vaccine has 2 antigens from factor H binding protein (fHbp) from serogroup B, 1 from subfamily A, and 1 from subfamily B (A05 and B01). The Bexsero(R) vaccine has antigens from Neisserial adhesin A (NadA), fHbp, and PorA P1.4 found in the outer membrane vesicles. Vaccination with meningococcal group B vaccine provides bactericidal protection against invasive disease by vaccine-derived antibody response.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    For IM administration only
  • Intramuscular
    • For IM administration only
    • Administer by IM injection, preferably in the deltoid muscle of the upper arm; shake well before use
    • Do not mix with other vaccines in the same syringe

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• serologic response to the vaccine (eg, antibody titers) may indicate efficacy.
  • No specific monitoring has been determined.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include injection site pain, muscle pain, headache, fatigue, and chills.
  • Counsel patient on the importance of completing the entire immunization series.
